7/3 Were I in the Academy, it would get my Best Picture vote. Yes, it would be a political vote. So what? This is an absolutely vital movie.
6/3 I applaud the creators of Hidden Figures for making an unsublte movie, one that a child -- or even a racist, sexist goon -- can grasp.
5/3 I probably won't re-watch Hidden Figures. It is not a subtle movie. But I hope every adolescent in America, nay, the world, sees it.
4/3 The story told by Hidden Figures is awe-inspiring, humbling, profoundly important for many reasons. I was crying as end credits rolled.
3/3 So lots of info was shoe-horned in, & some of the tropes were obvious, & the sound track hits you over the head with a hammer. But. . .
2/3 Script crammed so much info: the personalities & histories of the characters, intensity of the space race, brutal reality of Jim Crow.
1/3 Just saw Hidden Figures. Liked it lots. Screenplay: cheesy; schematic. Acting: fair to very good. Story: essential, profoundly moving.

. @sjoakley Firefighting is free therapy for me. Intellectually, physically & socially challenging; useful to others & beneficial to me.

@sjoakley When you're a firefighter you sometimes visit places of obvious disfunction. Our job is to extinguish fire. No further comment.
@sjoakley I agree. And evidently, this same house had had a fire before I came on the department. Astounding irresponsibility. But. . .
This article is fascinating and important, but funny in that it implies that Trump plays any role in decision-makin… https://t.co/F4potJR0d0
@JoelVanderWerf Agree on all counts.
@sjoakley The first one was bad; 2nd one could have gotten someone hurt or killed. I believe that Chief issued a citation, but I'm not sure.
@sjoakley When I became a firefighter, the very 1st fire I went to was a chimney fire. 1 year later, a fire in the same chimney. Astounding.
@sjoakley You would be astounded to learn how many people don't do that. We see fires where chimneys haven't been cleaned for a decade+.
6/3 @LillyLyle We on roof dropped chains; people inside collected burning debris in buckets from stove & carried it outside, doused w hoses.
5/3 @LillyLyle If the chimney had been breached by fire we would have had to use hoses and it would have been very destructive.
4/3 @LillyLyle Very little water used; maybe 1 liter. Hoses were there in case it got nasty inside, a precaution. Sometimes you need them.
3/3 @LillyLyle To minimize damage, we attack fire by dropping chains down chimney from roof; debris falls into wood stove below.
